{"step_by_step_thinking": "The ribosome does not have the ability to recognize the specific amino acid attached to the tRNA. Therefore, if a tRNA is mischarged with the wrong amino acid, the ribosome will still incorporate it into the growing peptide chain as long as the anticodon matches with the codon on the mRNA. The ribosome does not have the ability to remove the amino acid from the tRNA, nor does it have the ability to degrade the tRNA.
